## Description

This slides are to show a piece of code to run a 3D plot from the plotly package on the *iris* dataframe .


## Code for plotting a 3D plot

```{r code2, echo = T,eval=FALSE, message=FALSE}
fig <-plot_ly(x=iris$Sepal.Length, y=iris$Sepal.Width,z=iris$Petal.Lengt, color=as.factor(iris$Species),mode="markers" ,type="scatter3d")

fig <- fig %>% layout(
    title = "Iris Dataset",
    scene = list(
      xaxis = list(title = "Sepal Length"),
      yaxis = list(title = "Sepal Width"),
      zaxis = list(title = "Petal Length")
    ))

fig
```


## Plot
```{r plot, echo=FALSE, eval=TRUE,message=FALSE}
library(plotly)
fig <-plot_ly(x=iris$Sepal.Length, y=iris$Sepal.Width,z=iris$Petal.Lengt, color=as.factor(iris$Species),mode="markers" ,type="scatter3d")

fig <- fig %>% layout(
    title = "Iris Dataset",
    scene = list(
      xaxis = list(title = "Sepal Length"),
      yaxis = list(title = "Sepal Width"),
      zaxis = list(title = "Petal Length")
    ))

fig

```
